result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M Holmes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume illegal drugs.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must have no contact with the victims or their places of business unless participating in the Restorative Justice Program.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
May participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s).
Must follow through with psychiatric treatment.

02:31 PM Defendant Paul M Holmes in court by telephone means.  John A Rafa Todd appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Cara Lundequam appears in court.
Court relates Order Extending Probation was signed today and extended to 10/07/2020.  2 copies of Order given to Agent Lundequam and she will mail one to Defendant.
Court questions Defendant on amount he can pay and he states he can pay $50.00 bi-weekly or $100.00 monthly.  Court orders $50.00 every two weeks beginning October 1, 2019 and a wage assignment is to be entered. Agent Lundequam will forward the Order to the Agent in Michigan tomorrow, 09/18/19 and to Defendant.
